snippet: As he reframes his record to clear the way for Hillary Rodham Clinton’s White House bid, he says his 1994 law helped usher in an era of mass incarceration.
abstract: Former Pres Bill Clinton, addressing NAACP convention, disavows part of 1994 anti-crime bill he once strongly supported, concluding law wrongly imposed long prison sentences for minor crimes; statement follows Pres Obama's call for overhaul of criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: As he reframes his record to clear the way for Hillary Rodham Clinton’s White House bid, he says his 1994 law helped usher in an era of mass incarceration.

headline.main: Bill Clinton Concedes His Crime Law Jailed Too Many for Too Long
headline.print_headline: Bill Clinton Disavows His Crime Law as Jailing Too Many for Too Long

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
